title: Joining paths in IIIustrator
content:
I assume it’s good practice to make sure all points line up on the grid. But what if the intersection of two combined paths, let’s say, a crossbar plus a stem, do not fall on the grid? If I don’t add these paths into one, a paste in FontLab reveals some funky path inversions... Should I just ignore the misplacement of intersected points?

 [‹ Cross-Platform Development Font Issues](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404180214/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18017 "Go to previous forum topic") [How does ZapfDingbats.dfont work? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404180214/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17944 "Go to next forum topic")
author: koleslaw

comments.content: Why can’t you join the shape?
Joining the shapes will create points that dont’ fall on the grid.

This is a problem because fontlab requires integer coordinates. however, you do have the option of writing your own illustrator to UFO conversion script because the UFO file format allows floating point coordinates.
